title: binary_cross_functional throws "Unwrapping null optional"
body_html:
🐛 Bug

torch.nn.functional.binary_cross_functional throws "Unwrapping null optional" if exactly one of reduce or size_average is not None. This was introduced by #13707.

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. binary_cross_entropy(torch.ones(3, 3), torch.ones(3, 3), reduce=False)
  2. binary_cross_entropy(torch.ones(3, 3), torch.ones(3, 3), size_average=False)
body_text:
🐛 Bug
torch.nn.functional.binary_cross_functional throws "Unwrapping null optional" if exactly one of reduce or size_average is not None. This was introduced by #13707.

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

binary_cross_entropy(torch.ones(3, 3), torch.ones(3, 3), reduce=False)
binary_cross_entropy(torch.ones(3, 3), torch.ones(3, 3), size_average=False)
body:
## 🐛 Bug

[`torch.nn.functional.binary_cross_functional`](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/6d094224b990b78d1629a86d3e21cb9f188a3a8b/torch/nn/functional.py#L1772) throws "Unwrapping null optional" if exactly one of `reduce` or `size_average` is not `None`. This was introduced by [#13707](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/5163a289172efa3079f2e6169970db743a3e1001#diff-c66288b9ce36978f377a1a20d32ec53dR1772).

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. `binary_cross_entropy(torch.ones(3, 3), torch.ones(3, 3), reduce=False)`
2. `binary_cross_entropy(torch.ones(3, 3), torch.ones(3, 3), size_average=False)`
